name: Design of Everyday Things
desc: A project-based course examining how principles from cognitive science apply to the design of things simple (doors) and complex (new technology). Learn about affordances, constraints, mappings, and conceptual models. Learn observational and design skills. Become a human-centered design thinker.

name: Undergraduate Seminar
desc: Special topics in design are discussed. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit four times when topics vary.

name: Independent Study
desc: Independent literature or laboratory research by arrangement with and under direction of a design faculty member. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit three times.
misc_prereq: Lower-division standing, completion of thirty units of UC San Diego undergraduate study, a minimum UC San Diego GPA of 3.0, and a completed and approved Special Studies form.

name: Prototyping
desc: Explores cognitive principles of thinking through making. Introduces methods and tools for prototyping user experiences. Students make various prototypes and participate in weekly critique sessions. Topics: experience design, rapid prototyping, sketching, bodystorming, cardboard modeling, UI hacking, and design theory.

name: Design for Future Creativity and Productivity
desc: This course covers fundamentals of the design of creativity support tools for various types of digital content, including images, videos, animations, information visualization, augmented/mixed/virtual reality. We will also explore how novel interaction techniques such as gestural interaction, speech input, and artificial intelligence can be used to support people’s creativity and productivity.
prereq1: COGS 120 or COGS 187A or COGS 187B or CSE 170 or DSGN 100

name: Design at Large
desc: New societal challenges, cultural values, and technological opportunities are changing design—and vice versa. The seminar explores this increased scale, real-world engagement, and disruptive impact. Invited speakers from UC San Diego and beyond share cutting-edge research on interaction, design, and learning. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit up to four times.

name: Special Topics in Design
desc: Special topics in design. May be taken for credit three times when topics vary.
misc_prereq: Upper-division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Design Project
desc: Special topics in design. May be taken for credit three times when topics vary. Recommended preparation: may require shop skills.
misc_prereq: Upper-division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Instructional Apprenticeship in Design
desc: Students, under the direction of the instructor, lead laboratory or discussion sections, attend lectures, and meet regularly with the instructor to help prepare course materials and grade papers and exams. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit two times.
misc_prereq: Upper-division standing, 3.0 GPA, consent of instructor, and department approval.

name: Directed Group Study
desc: This directed group study course is for small groups of advanced students who wish to complete a one-quarter reading or research project under the mentorship of a faculty member. Students should contact faculty whose research interests them to discuss possible projects. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit up to three times.
misc_prereq: Upper-division standing, 2.5 GPA, consent of instructor, and department approval.

name: Independent Project
desc: This independent project course is for individual, advanced students who wish to complete a design project under the mentorship of a faculty member. Students should contact faculty whose research interests them to discuss possible projects. P/NP grades only. May be taken for credit three times.
misc_prereq: Upper-division standing, 2.5 GPA, consent of instructor, and department approval.

name: Human-Centered Design and Complex Sociotechnical Systems
desc: This course will teach fundamentals of design from an explicitly multi-epistemic and multidisciplinary lens. Foundations on both power and privilege and ethical responses within design will be emphasized. A range of design strategies, from a classic professional-led approach to co-design and community-driven variations of design will be reviewed.

name: Advanced Topics in Design
desc: Special topics in design. May be taken for credit eighteen times.
misc_prereq: Graduate standing and consent of instructor.

name: Advanced Design Project
desc: Special topics in design. S/U grades only. May be taken for credit three times. Recommended preparation: may require maker-lab or shop skills.
misc_prereq: Graduate standing and consent of instructor.

name: Independent Project
desc: Students study, research, and implement project under the direction of a member of the faculty. S/U grades only. May be taken for credit three times. Recommended preparation: may require maker-lab or shop skills.
misc_prereq: Graduate standing and consent of instructor.
